definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]

sentences.english: This is then broadcasted live to Google's website.
sentences.chinese: 這是當時現場直播，以谷歌的網站。

sentences.english: ATV will offer real live broadcast matches and highlights for soccer fans to enjoy at home.
sentences.chinese: 亞洲電視將作現場直播及作精華介紹。

sentences.english: You can use them with a content stream that's compressed on-the-fly, for example in a live-event broadcast.
sentences.chinese: 也可以用它們傳輸即時壓縮的內容流，例如現場直播。

sentences.english: Is it a live broadcast or a recorded one?
sentences.chinese: 這是現場直播還是錄相節目？

sentences.english: It is always a live TV broadcast of spring Festival programme.
sentences.chinese: 春節晚會的節目都是現場直播的。

sentences.english: The first is from a producer of a leading current-events TV show.
sentences.chinese: 第一個來自現場直播的電視節目生產者。

sentences.english: The football games came to you live from New York.
sentences.chinese: 本場足球比賽是從紐約爲您現場直播的。

sentences.english: The blastoff was also broadcasted live on state-owned television and through the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 這次發射也在國有電視及互聯網上進行了現場直播。

sentences.english: The numbers was chosen by machine live on television.
sentences.chinese: 彩票中獎號碼由機器在電視現場直播選出。

sentences.english: It is estimated that the debate will be televised live this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 據估計這個辯論賽將會在週末現場直播。

sentences.english: For example as a backchannel during live programming.
sentences.chinese: 比如在現場直播節目中。

sentences.english: The Tiangong-2 launch was telecast live on state TV.
sentences.chinese: 天宮二號發射時，電視進行了現場直播。

sentences.english: The World Cup finalis being transmitted live to over fifty countries.
sentences.chinese: 世界盃決賽現在正向五十多個國家現場直播。

sentences.english: Live standup is provided by such live truck.
sentences.chinese: 現場直播需要這樣靈活的裝載車。

sentences.english: Journalists could broadcast interviews using it -- and already are.
sentences.chinese: 記者可以用它來現場直播採訪內容。

sentences.english: CNR will offer real live broadcast of the Opening Ceromony of the Paralympics.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民廣播電臺將對殘奧會開幕式進行現場直播。

definition: (of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
barrage (military)/"bullet screen", function which allows viewers to post on-screen comments in videos, movies etc in real time/danmaku (video game subgenre)
live (e.g. broadcast or recording)/what is actually happening/scene/the real situation
time of day exactly on the hour (i.e. 12:00, 1:00 etc)/to make an inventory/(math.) point that has integer coordinates
iQiyi, online video platform based in Beijing, launched in 2010
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
